section.title: Overview
section.para: This module serves as a storage engine for PCSCF contacts, much like the standard Kamailio module, usrloc, is a storage engine for standard SIP contacts. The concept of a contact in IMS, PCSCF specifically, is very different to that of std. SIP and as a result we have built this new module. Alot of the design has been borrowed from the std. usrloc module. For example. An IMS contact, in PCSCF, needs things like:

listitem.para: Diameter Rx session for signalling bearer status. i.e. this is effectively QoS from the network to make sure the signalling link can be 'trusted'
IPSEC Security Assocation for secure signalling between UE and PCSCF (first point of contact)
IMPU, each contact can have a number of associated public identities (IMPU).

section.title: hash_size (int)
section.para: The number of entries of the hash table used by to store the contact records is 2^hash_size. For hash_size=4, the number of entries of the hash table is 16.

section.title: timer_interval (int)
section.para: Number of seconds between two timer runs. The module uses timer to delete expired contacts.

section.title: db_mode (int)
section.para: This is the database mode to be used for the PCSCF usrloc data persistent storage. Currently this module supports the Write-Through scheme only.

listitem.para: 0 - This disables DB mode. Only memory will be used for usrloc and data will not survive a restart.

1 - Write-Through Scheme. All changes to usrloc are immediately refelcted in the database. This is slow but very reliable. This mode will ensure that no registration data is lost as a result of a restart or crash.
